Class BookList

java.lang.Object
BookList
public class BookList extends Object
Author:
Rami Al Najem (40242034) and Fouad Meida (40249310) COMP249 Assignment #4 Due date: April 17th, 2023

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    BookList()
    Constructs an empty BookList with null head.

  • Constructor Details

    • BookList

      public BookList()
      Constructs an empty BookList with null head.

  • Method Details

    • addToStart

      public void addToStart(Book b)
      Adds a book to the start of the list.
      Parameters:
      b - the book to be added

    • addToEnd

      public void addToEnd(Book b)
      Adds a new book to the end of the circular linked list.
      Parameters:
      b - the Book to be added to the end of the list

    • storeRecordsByYear

      public void storeRecordsByYear(int yr)
      Creates a new file that contains all records of the specified year.
      Parameters:
      yr - the year to search for records

    • insertBefore

      public boolean insertBefore(long isbn, Book b1)
      Inserts a book before the specified ISBN in the list.
      Parameters:
      isbn - the ISBN before which the book will be inserted
      b1 - the book to be inserted
      Returns:
      true if the book was successfully inserted, false otherwise

    • insertBetween

      public boolean insertBetween(long isbn1, long isbn2, Book b1)
      Inserts a new book object before the node with ISBN number isbn1 or isbn2, if found. If neither ISBN number is found, the method returns false.
      Parameters:
      isbn1 - the ISBN number of the node before which the new book object is to be inserted
      isbn2 - the ISBN number of the node before which the new book object is to be inserted
      b1 - the book object to be inserted
      Returns:
      true if the new book object is successfully inserted, false otherwise

    • displayContent

      public void displayContent()
      Displays the content of the book list by printing the string representation of each book in the list in order, followed by an arrow indicating the next book, and finally the word "head" to indicate the end of the list. If the list is empty, prints a message indicating that the list is empty.

    • delConsecutiveRepeatedRecords

      public boolean delConsecutiveRepeatedRecords()
      Deletes consecutive repeated records from the list.
      Returns:
      true if any records were deleted, false otherwise

    • extractAuthList

      public BookList extractAuthList(String aut)
      Creates a new BookList containing all the books in this list with the specified author.
      Parameters:
      aut - the author to search for
      Returns:
      a new BookList containing all the books in this list with the specified author

    • swap

      public boolean swap(long isbn1, long isbn2)
      Swaps the positions of two books in the circular linked list with the given ISBNs.
      Parameters:
      isbn1 - the ISBN of the first book to be swapped
      isbn2 - the ISBN of the second book to be swapped
      Returns:
      true if the books were successfully swapped, false otherwise

    • commit

      public void commit()
      Writes the contents of the BookList to a text file named "Update_Books.txt". This method appends the contents to the existing file, if any. If the file does not exist, a new file is created. If an I/O error occurs while writing to the file, an error message is printed to the console.
